creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The cut nodes are not removed from the sitetree after cut & paste, though the
documents are removed. When you access the cut node, the output is "No overview
available".

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
i can't confirm this, but the current behaviour is not optimal either.
currently, when you "cut", the nodes stay where they are, and only move when you
"paste". they should at least be greyed out while in "limbo" state.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> i can't confirm this, but the current behaviour is not optimal either.
> currently, when you "cut", the nodes stay where they are, and only move when you
> "paste". they should at least be greyed out while in "limbo" state.

That is the case in 1.2, somehow it got lost in 1.4.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The documents are now greyed out, but they're still greyed out when pasted. The
clipboard is probably still attached to the session.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> The documents are now greyed out, but they're still greyed out when pasted.

This should be OK now.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> The cut nodes are not removed from the sitetree after cut & paste, though the
> documents are removed. When you access the cut node, the output is "No overview
> available".

Maybe it's related to the browser settings. I can't reproduce it anymore.

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
cut and paste now seem to work as intended.
cut nodes are displayed in light red with grey background, and after pasting
them, the sitetree view is updated correctly.
